result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua L Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed as long as defendant is making minimum $100 per month payments starting 4/1/15. If stay is lifted, jail is to be served after jail time imposed in case no. 14-CT-88.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith.
Outstanding financial obligations have been reduced to civil judgment.

for sentence modification - Defendant requesting furlough to get job. Per Court, approved. 72 hour furlough to find job; denied report time at 10/22/15 sentencing, he has almost 5 months remaining on sentence.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Joshua L Krueger in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, charges, max. penalties, receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant, recommendation contained therein. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defense requests time to report. Court questions Defendant on employment possibilities. State opposes request, presents argument. Court imposes sentence.

Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is prepared to enter plea today, would like to put off sentencing for 60 days to allow Defendant time to get work/living situation worked out, is moving to Algoma. State is prepared to proceed to plea/sentencing today. Further discussion regarding payment. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Joshua L Krueger in court with attorney Stephen P. Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defense advises that offer will be accepted, requests 60 days to straighten out work situation, was working through ABR, hopes to get prior job back.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
